nodes.bodyText:
hey @ulrikstrid explicitly listing the testdir does not seem to be necessary - for example 
  
    
      FrameworkBenchmarks/.travis.yml
    
    
        Lines 15 to 16
      in
      30bb2a4
    
    
    
    

        
          
           - "TESTLANG=C" 
        

        
          
           - "TESTLANG=CSharp" 
        
    
  


(my PR for opium was also merged yesterday, so the list is not full)

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,35 @@
+FROM alpine:latest as certs
+RUN apk --update add ca-certificates
+
+FROM reasonnative/web:4.10.0 as builder
+
+RUN mkdir /app
+WORKDIR /app
+
+COPY src/esy.json src/morph-tfb.opam /app/
+
+RUN esy install
+RUN esy build --release

nodes.bodyText: is the second esy install intended?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,35 @@
+FROM alpine:latest as certs
+RUN apk --update add ca-certificates
+
+FROM reasonnative/web:4.10.0 as builder
+
+RUN mkdir /app
+WORKDIR /app
+
+COPY src/esy.json src/morph-tfb.opam /app/
+
+RUN esy install
+RUN esy build --release
+
+COPY ./src/bin /app/src/bin
+
+RUN esy install

nodes.bodyText: are these certs automatically used by morph?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,35 @@
+FROM alpine:latest as certs
+RUN apk --update add ca-certificates
+
+FROM reasonnative/web:4.10.0 as builder
+
+RUN mkdir /app
+WORKDIR /app
+
+COPY src/esy.json src/morph-tfb.opam /app/
+
+RUN esy install
+RUN esy build --release
+
+COPY ./src/bin /app/src/bin
+
+RUN esy install
+
+RUN esy dune build --profile=docker --release
+
+RUN esy mv "#{self.target_dir / 'default' / 'bin' / 'tfb.exe'}" main.exe
+
+RUN strip main.exe
+
+FROM scratch as runtime
+
+ENV OPENSSL_STATIC=1
+ENV SSL_CERT_FILE=/etc/ssl/certs/ca-certificates.crt
+ENV SSL_CERT_DIR=/etc/ssl/certs
+COPY --from=certs /etc/ssl/certs/ca-certificates.crt /etc/ssl/certs/

nodes.bodyText:
I added a .gitignore to /OCaml: 
  
    
      FrameworkBenchmarks/frameworks/OCaml/.gitignore
    
    
        Lines 1 to 4
      in
      30bb2a4
    
    
    
    

        
          
           **/_opam 
        

        
          
           **/_build 
        

        
          
           .merlin 
        

        
          
           .ocamlformat 
        
    
  


these ignores seems to be very common for OCaml and esy, should they be at that level for convenience for others?
